channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No entry dog sign removed again!, 11th July
item.description:
The no dog entry sign by the bridge has been removed/torn down, and needs to be replaced again!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carlton Parade, Poverest, Orpington, London

item.title: Blocked drain, 11th July
item.description:
There is a blocked drain in the alleyway between house numbers 11 and 13, Charlesfield, SE9 4NX. The blockage needs urgent attention to prevent future flooding and damage to nearby properties, including mine. Please send someone to inspect and fix this as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlesfield, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bin bag left on street, 11th July
item.description:
At the southern end of Oakhurst Grove, right next to the bike storage, a black bin bag has been dumped for the last week. It doesn't look like much, but there's something weird about it as its extremely heavy - it feels like wet cement or something.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Oakhurst Grove, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Missing Road/Street name sign., 11th July
item.description:
Uplands School hired some guys to fit a new gate to the school fence at the corner of Harlington Road + Stratton Road. To fit the gate they removed the Harlington Road sign. But after fitting the gate they have not put back said Road sign. Are the Council aware of this & are you going to get the School to put it back in place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress & sheets dumped in butterfield park (2nd report), 11th July
item.description:

item.title: Household waste, furniture, 11th July
item.description:
Ten days household waste and furniture have been damped behind the wall facing Woodpecker road. It is not the first time. Some residents of Whimbrel close ( number 3 or 4) have been seen and challenged few times but continue put their rubbish/ waste here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whimbrel Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal Bollards and Chains Destroyed, 11th July
item.description:
Numerous metal bollards and chains broken and lying over the ground right opposite St. James’s Palace. Has been like this repeatedly and for a very long time but nothing is done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pall Mall, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish from flats blocking pavement, 11th July
item.description:
The rubbish has been here for 4 days not collected, it’s stopping our customers from getting to our business. Wherlchair uses are complaining they have to go on the road where the crossings are, putting them on the road for 60 metres.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Morning Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
